text: Françoise Paulette Louise Dorléac (21 March 194226 June 1967) was a French actress and model. She was the oldest sister of Catherine Deneuve. She was known for her roles in Philippe de Broca's movie L'homme de Rio, François Truffaut's La peau douce, Roman Polanski's Cul-de-sac, and Val Guest's Where the Spies Are. Dorléac was killed in a car crash on 26 June 1967 in Nice, France at the age of 25. ==Other websites== * * Category:1942 births Category:1967 deaths Category:French movie actors Category:French television actors Category:French stage actors Category:Models from Paris Category:Actors from Paris Category:Road accident deaths
title: Françoise Dorléac
